ResponsesInList.Text: Gracias Fernando, lo he probado con un moodle version 2.4.6 y no me ha dado problemas así que espero que ocurra lo mismo en el 3.1 con Adaptable.

ResponsesInList.Title: Evolve-D theme after 3.0
ResponsesInList.Text: Issue at hand: I'm using a version of the Evolve-D theme. After upgrading to 3.0, if I have the navigation block docked, the rest of the blocks will fall below "region-main". But once I undock "Navigation", the blocks will restore to "side-post" (right) position. I've looked into the code and it seems like it's these two things that are causing it: .jsenabled.docked-region-side-pre.empty-region-side-pre.used-region-side-post #region-main { width: 100%; } .empty-region-side-pre.used-region-side-post #region-main { width: 100%; } Where do I go to get rid of these 2 lines? Original Posting: https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=330289&parent=1329114

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Evolve-D theme after 3.0
ResponsesInList.Text: The reasons these CSS lines are there is because they are legacy CSS rules for theme that use those classes. The fact they are doing what they are doing is that some other code must be missing. So it is not a case of removing those rules but adding one that will fix the problem. I'll test it and get back to you. Cheers Mary

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Evolve-D theme after 3.0
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, It actually does this in Moodle 2.9 if both Navigation and Administration blocks are docked. The reason this is happening is the way in which the blocks have been added to the layout. Since it is only a 2 column theme, it only needs one block region, but Evolved has both visible. So the easiest thing to do is move the ones that fall to the bottom of the screen and drag them into the section where the Navigation block is. You will see which is the default block region as the ADD BLOCK will be showing in it. So with Editing ON drag all the blocks from below the Add Block to above it. Turn editing OFF and test to see what happens. Cheers Mary

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Evolve-D theme after 3.0
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Mary, Your trick seems to have worked! (As long as the "Add a block" is under all the other blocks then it would work fine.) All in all, the CSS probably needs to be updated to reflect 3.0? Or what if I modify the code to display only one block region? Thanks for lending a hand, Robin

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Evolve-D theme after 3.0
ResponsesInList.Text: The CSS for the blocks is OK in Moodle 3.0 there is no change to it as it is classed as Legacy CSS. The layouts have changed in Moodle Bootstrapbase, Clean and More themes. The fact Evolved has a different layout set up is a mystery. Perhaps just leave as is and get the theme Author to change it. If you start meddling with the theme files then you will run into issues you will not be able to solve so stick with the easy fix of just moving the blocks as the empty block region will be hidden from view by nature of the CSS in Moodle. If anything goes wrong with the theme it will be a coding error that has to be fixed by a developer. It looks to be working OK in my Moodle 3.0 which is running the latest version and with debugging enabled. Cheers Mary

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Evolve-D theme after 3.0
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks Mary. Your explanation was very useful.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Evolve-D theme after 3.0
ResponsesInList.Text: Evolve-D isn't ready for 3.0.  In fact I might have to completely overhaul it.  This was my first attempt at writing a theme for Moodle and while it did the trick while we were on Moodle 2.7 and 2.8 it was very much a learning process. I have it on the agenda to take a look at what can be done this summer to bring it up to speed with Moodle.  However, we are also migrating our sites to completely new servers and that will be top priority.

ResponsesInList.Title: Change header in each course
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, I'm using Moodle1.8. I want that each of my courses has special header. for example if you enter the course A the top header will change. I think I should have a if condition that checks the courseID but I can not find the parameter related to the courseID and I don't know where should I write this code. Does anybody know what should I do?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Change header in each course
ResponsesInList.Text: One way to do it (and not only for header) is to set different css for different courses - add it to your theme css file(s) For example .course-2 #header { background: url(bg1.gif) no-repeat top left; } adds background image bg1.gif to course id 2 header (course id 1 is home page)

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Change header in each course
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Mauna, Thank you for your answer but if I add this css to my css file then I think some where in the php codes I should say for example if(courseID == 2) then read .course-2,isn't it? would you please explain for me?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Change header in each course
ResponsesInList.Text: Moodle takes course id from css without any extra php code so if you want to add for example bg3.gif to background image of course id 3 header use .course-3 #header { background: url(bg3.gif) no-repeat top left; } (it's actually second course you have created - you see the course id from address bar when you go to course)

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Change header in each course
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Mauno, I am using Imagine2 as my site theme. I have tried to add your code into some of my css files, including styles_color.css, styles_fonts.css and styles_layout.css. I don't know whether those are the only ones need to be modified, but the course header didn't change, it was still as same as the picture apeared on the home page header. Could you explain in more details about how to add the code? Lots of thanks.

ResponsesInList.Title: Uncaught Error Message In (DevTools)
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello All , I'm getting this error in developer tools ( Uncaught Error: No define call for theme_boost/bootstrap http://requirejs.org/docs/errors.html#nodefine at makeError (require.min.js:1) at Object.completeLoad (require.min.js:1) at HTMLScriptElement.onScriptLoad (require.min.js:1) ) How I can fix this error? Very strange I'm not using Boost theme in moodle (I'm Using Academi theme) I Checked: root dir > Lib > requirejs > require.min.js (Seems that the file is ok). Please Help! Thank you In Advanced!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Uncaught Error Message In (DevTools)
ResponsesInList.Text: Broken JavaScript (JS) somewhere, or malformed markup that is breaking the JS or missing files and please read the forum rules before posting.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Uncaught Error Message In (DevTools)
ResponsesInList.Text: I found a solution....! the require.min.js was damaged! I deleted that file from: root dir > Lib > requirejs > require.min.js, then unpacked the Academi theme and re-uploaded the file again... error gone.... But it was very strange.. Can't understand, how the error was triggered if i wasn't using that theme (Boost Theme).. By the way Here Is My Site

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Uncaught Error Message In (DevTools)
ResponsesInList.Text: The JS in all the themes installed is referenced regardless of the active theme.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle Theme ORANGEWHITE

ResponsesInList.Title: Essential theme question
ResponsesInList.Text: The Essential theme is base on the Bootstrap framework. What version of Bootstrap is Essential using? We are using Moodle 3.0.5. I read that Moodle 3.2 will use Bootstrap 4. Will that affect all the themes (specially Essential the one that we use) if we upgrade to Moodle 3.2 when it is available? Thanks for your answers, Carlos

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Essential theme question
ResponsesInList.Text: Essential uses the Bootstrap framework version 2.3.2 independently in the M2.9 and 3.0 versions and as a child of the 'Bootstrapbase' theme. It is my understanding that 'bootstrapbase' will continue to be Bootstrap 2.3.2 in M3.2.  And only 'Boost' will be Bootstrap 4.  Where did you read 'I read that Moodle 3.2 will use Bootstrap 4'? For Moodle 3.2 I will need to see how much effort is required to make a M3.2 version.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Essential theme question
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks Gareth for the explanation. I was totally confused. I thought that all the themes were moving to Bootstrap 4 not only Boost. The reason that I asked was some advanced users in my institution, were asking me about Bootstrap. They like some features like: popups (modal) or responsive images from Bootstrap. Just one more question, if you can help me. If we use the Essential theme, and we want to modify it we will need to use Less. If we decide to use Boost we will need to use Sass to work with it, right? Thanks for your help, Carlos

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Essential theme question
ResponsesInList.Text: Yes, that's right Carlos, you will need SASS to modify Boost compared to LESS with themes using other versions of Bootstrap - although both Essential and Boost will also take straight CSS , either in their style files or in front-end settings. Essential has its CustomCSS setting box and you can add standard CSS in the customSCSS setting on Boost and it should work (haven't tested it yet, but LESS/SASS are basically extensions on CSS so standard CSS should also work in that setting box). Boost also has the new 'presets' which allow a bootswatch type file to be created and used to style the theme (basically its a SASS variables file). If your users want to use bootstrap features and its already part of the theme you use, then they can use it in their content. The only consideration is that they will need to use code snippets matching the bootstrap version in your theme (eg. Essential - BS2.x, Flexibase - BS3.x, Boost - BS4) Hope that helps Richard

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Essential theme question
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Carlos, Please see Richard's reply. Kind regards, Gareth

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Essential theme question
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks Richard and Gareth. It really makes sense for me now.

ResponsesInList.Title: Adaptable Theme (Making the Header Banner Clickable)
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello Everyone, I was wondering how to make a clickable banner logo using the Adaptable Theme. As there is no customization field where one can specify a url in the theme parameters of the Moodle interface, I was wondering how this could be done either by using HTML/ CSS or modifying the Php theme coding. Any help/pointers would be greatly appreciated. Thanks, Bob Moodle Version: 3.4 Adaptable Theme: 1.6.0.2

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adaptable Theme (Making the Header Banner Clickable)
ResponsesInList.Text: If you upload a logo that is clickable and will return you to the front page of your Moodle site. Are you saying that you want to link to a different URL other than the Moodle front page?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adaptable Theme (Making the Header Banner Clickable)
ResponsesInList.Text: No, I just want to make a clickable banner using the Adaptable Theme or modifying it somehow. Many thank, Bob

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adaptable Theme (Making the Header Banner Clickable)
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, Moodle page header used to be a clickable area, and also a good place to add an image using some Custom CSS,  but this was depreciated after lots of people became annoyed because every time they wanted to click a menu item in the navbar, which is above the page header area, they were clicking too soon and ended up being taken to the home page from wherever they where. So, are you absolutely sure you want the banner to be click-able? It's not a good idea really unless you want to direct people to another page or outside your Moodle site  completely. Cheers Mary

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adaptable Theme (Making the Header Banner Clickable)
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi, I understand that this is an older post, but I have the same question and the original poster. Is it possible to add a link to the header logo for the adaptable theme? I have added the suggested code for adding the logo - background image. The image shows and works well. #page-header { background: 0 none; background-image: url(); background-position: right top; background-repeat: no-repeat; background-size:  100% auto; } I've created a background image that I would like to be clickable. The link will bring people to another page for additional membership information. I can't figure out how to make the image clickable while using the adaptable theme. Is there any code I could use to create a link to the background image? Any information would be appreciated. Using the latest moodle and theme. Thank you, Rod

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adaptable Theme (Making the Header Banner Clickable)
ResponsesInList.Text: The header background image is already included in Adaptable so you don't need to add any custom CSS or image. Just upload the image in the Header settings section. And no, it is not clickable for many reasons but mainly because is a very bad UX practice. Ypu can add an image in the header using the title option, and also used to add a second logo, and then add a link to it.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Adaptable Theme (Making the Header Banner Clickable)
ResponsesInList.Text: Thank you that worked for me by adding the image to the title box and then a link onto the image.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Can I remove YUI from styles?
ResponsesInList.Text: That all depends on whether or not your theme depends on those styles? Which theme is this?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Can I remove YUI from styles?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Patrick, How do we know whether a theme depends on the YUI styles? What are the YUI styles for, anyway? Joseph

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Can I remove YUI from styles?
ResponsesInList.Text: I thought the YUI styles are only in Moodle 2 and there's a lot of them!!!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Can I remove YUI from styles?
ResponsesInList.Text: The YUI library has been a part of the Moodle core since 2006 - http://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=48478 All the styles are in /moodle/lib/yui/ and available to themes if desired.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Can I remove YUI from styles?
ResponsesInList.Text: As far as I know, all pre-2.0 themes have to explicitly call the YUI styles in order to use theme. You'd find reference in the theme's styles.php or header.html file. I don't know of any existing themes in the database that use them. The YUI styles provide a framework for building a theme. There is a reset, base, font, and grid stylesheet. There's a good introduction video on the YUI site: http://developer.yahoo.com/yui/base/#video

ResponsesInList.Title: Help! Moving a theme to a new install
ResponsesInList.Text: I have two installs of the same version of Moodle 1.8 and I have created a custom theme for one of these. Now I am trying to move this theme to the other server and other installation. I selected the new theme and some of it did show up correctly. The problem is that it is still spitting out styles from the old stylesheet that no longer exists. So what do I have to change to get this to work correctly?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Help! Moving a theme to a new install
ResponsesInList.Text: Press Ctrl+F5 at the same time. This should clear your cache if it has not cleared itself by now.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Help! Moving a theme to a new install
ResponsesInList.Text: Clearing the browser cache is not the issue. It seems that the server cache the old style sheets and every time I move new style changes to the live server nothing happens. All the files are there but the site still reflects the old style. Is there an easy fix for this so I don't have to restart the server/clear the servers cache every time I move styles sheets from one server to the next?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Help! Moving a theme to a new install
ResponsesInList.Text: As you are saying you created the theme. did you use hardcoded links? Ar you sure that the theme is not trying to point to old locations. Moodle Themes should be built using relative url's or tags like $ wwwroot to have relative paths created for you.

ResponsesInList.Title: Font size in cornflower theme

Kind Regards, Adam

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Font size in cornflower theme
ResponsesInList.Text: Adam, try this: h1 { font-size:1.7em!important; margin:0.5em 0 0; }

Gareth

ResponsesInList.Title: Newbie needing banner assistance.
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello everyone, I'll start by adding a disclaimer that i'm useless at computer coding, if it's very simple and broken down step by step, i can just about manage it. But my problem is - The banner at the top of our moodle website, I've been into Front Page Settings and can successfully change the text to just about anything I want. But what I want to be able to do it add a picture logo or even a flash logo. I already have both, but have no idea how to get them "up there". Cheers in advance for any help.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Newbie needing banner assistance.
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Chris, the logo in your header is not controlled by Front Page settings. It's a part of your theme. The easiest way to get an image in your header is to change your theme to 'standardlogo' and then simply upload a file called logo.jpg or logo.gif in your Site Files (look on the home page), or put a file called logo.jpg or logo.gif in the main Moodle directory. If you have already custoimised your theme and want to keep that and include a logo, then have a look at http://docs.moodle.org/en/Header_logo . You only need to change one file, header.html. Hope this helps

ResponsesInList.Title: Moodle 2.2 MyMobile Theme CAS Auth
ResponsesInList.Text: Has anyone successfully used the new MyMobile theme when Moodle is set up to use CAS authentication? I have been testing it and just an error when I click Login on the mobile theme.  However, if I go directly to my CAS page and login then go back to Moodle /login/index.php it detects CAS and authenticates me correctly.  I'm guessing it's just a simple tweak that needs to be made, but I'm not sure.  Any insight?  Thanks for your help.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle 2.2 MyMobile Theme CAS Auth
ResponsesInList.Text: I did some more digging and finally found the problem.  If you're using external authentication, you must add the data- ajax ="false" tag to the Login link.  I tested this with Moodle internal authentication, too, and it works. So, I will put a ticket in to fix this bug. In the meantime, edit renderers.php in the theme package.  On line 342, add data-ajax="false" somewhere within the  <a> tag.

ResponsesInList.Title: Essential V3.4.1.1 - beta with Privacy API - released.
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello, Firstly.... do not install this update unless you are running Moodle 3.4.2 and above.  Secondly, if you use the analytics settings then also think carefully before upgrading and read in full what I have to say here. V3.4.1.1(beta) for M3.4.2: https://moodle.org/plugins/pluginversion.php?id=16438 Ok.... Because of the new EU GDPR regulation that comes into force on the 25th May 2018 there is now a new Privacy API in Moodle ( https://docs.moodle.org/dev/Privacy_API ) - this is only available in Moodle inter-version versions of 3.3+.  In the case of 3.4 that is 3.4.2.  All plugins will need to either state why they are not affected or describe the user data they do along with other methods to export that data. To learn more about this area, then please consider looking at: https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=352538 https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=365857 Also as the plugin area of Moodle.org does not support specifying specific versions for this I've raised MDLSITE-5390 . From an Essential theme point of view I have examined the settings and apart from the analytics could not find any storage of 'user related' data - at least not on purpose by the theme.  But, I am not a lawyer and welcome any input in this area pertaining to Essential if you consider there is a gap in the code for coping with GDPR. I have done some testing with the data privacy tool - https://moodle.org/plugins/tool_dataprivacy - but that is under development too and does not seem to show the 'privacy' statement within the theme but it looks as if it will. Essential's privacy statement is as follows: "The Essential theme stores lots of settings that pertain to its configuration.  None of the settings are related to a specific user.  It is your responsibility to ensure that no user data is entered in any of the free text fields.  Setting a setting will result in that action being logged within the core Moodle logging system against the user whom changed it, this is outside of the themes control, please see the core logging system for privacy compliance for this.  The analytics settings and associated data in the database have been removed until this area is more understood from a legal perspective, as it was possible to request that userid's were recorded.  Please examine the code carefully to be sure that it complies with your interpretation of your privacy laws.  I am not a lawyer and my analysis is based on my interpretation.  If you have any doubt then remove the theme forthwith." With the analytics there was the option to request that the user id was passed to the external analytics software.  This seemed to me at the current time to be a grey area.  Therefore this version - 3.4.1.1 - removes the analytics settings and their values in the database.  Therefore if you don't have a backup of those setting values then do make a note of them before upgrading.  If you require analytics and do not need to comply with GDPR then for the moment, I suggest you don't upgrade. It is my intent to implement the privacy API for all my current plugins for all the major Moodle versions it is implemented in.  This may or may not be before 25th May 2018. Comments / thoughts appreciated. Gareth

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Safe Themes !!!
ResponsesInList.Text:
In what way would a theme be dangerous? OK - malicious code being added I guess: Get it from a reputable source ie the Moodle plugins database ! I would recommend using themes that are in the Moodle plugins database as these have to go through the Moodle HQ systems to be accepted into the database in the first place, they are usually also announced in the theme forum where Gareth or Mary or someone else will often take them for a trial. While some of these maybe better than others (for your particular purpose - I am not commenting on quality or otherwise of any theme!), none of them should break your site. If you need a customised, or personalised, theme then (personal opinion)
I would recommend speaking to one of the regular contributors on the
themes forum, or to a moodle partner, for quotes around any development work you would like done. And at the end of the day, two points: 1. a theme is only a plugin and can always be removed and your site will revert back to the default core theme (Clean) 2. always test any plugin (theme or otherwise) on a test system to ensure there are no clashes with any other third party plugins - it is impossible for anyone to test every plugin with every other combination of 3rd party plugins available, so it is a good idea for you to test with your own combinations. Hope that helps Richard

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Safe Themes !!!
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks a lot Richard It certainly helps ...

ResponsesInList.Title: Moodle 2.0 theme changes progress
ResponsesInList.Text: Just thought I would let you all know how I was getting on. I just committed a big lot of changes to CVS . This is basically a rewrite of print_header and print_footer, so that instead of using header.html and footer.html, it uses a single file layout.php. Also, if you wish, for certain pages you can have a different template. layout-home.php and layout-popup.php are the ones I am thinking of initially. The layout.php file for the standard theme looks like http://cvs.moodle.org/moodle/theme/standardwhite/layout.php?view=markup This is all very much work in progress. I have just spent several days untangling the mess that is the old print_header, and have got to the 'wow, you mean it actually seems to work!' stage. I am sure there are still bugs that need to be found and fixed. Also there is more cleaning up to do in related code. However, becuase it is still very much in flux, this would be be a good time for people to have a look and give feedback, because it is not too late to change things if people have further good ideas. (By the way, if you have a Moodle 1.9 theme with header.html and footer.html, but not layout.php, that will still work, becuase I wrote fall-back code.)

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle 2.0 theme changes progress
ResponsesInList.Text: Wow! This is good.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle 2.0 theme changes progress
ResponsesInList.Text: print_header/footer were already doing buffered output in 1.9, so that aspect has not really changed. The code is here: http://cvs.moodle.org/moodle/lib/outputlib.php?view=annotate#l836 layout.php is included in $OUTPUT->header. The result is then sliced in half, and the footer stashed away for later. The trick is, of course, how you get dynamic information like performance info, and all the required links to JavaScript , which may change during the rendering of the page contents, into the footer. The answer is I put a couple of unique strings in the footer that are then str_replaced in $OUTPUT->footer. Before you ask, I have not profiled this yet. I am quite pleased that $OUTPUT->header fits on one screen. Rather better than the old print_header.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Moodle 2.0 theme changes progress
ResponsesInList.Text:
print_header/footer were already doing
buffered output in 1.9, so that aspect
has not really changed. They use OB internally, right. But they don't use it over the execution of the page which is what my unfounded fears were about. The code is here... Ah! I see what you're doing, makes sense. I pictured for a moment weird schemes that abuse OB and eval().

ResponsesInList.Title: Missing images in some standard and non-standard themes
ResponsesInList.Text: Just by chance, while I was looking at the error logs from our Apache server , I noticed that there were HUNDREDS of lines like the following: [Sun Jan 22 13:07:50 2006] [error] [client 80.58.35.235] File does not exist: /extern/web/httpd/htdocs/moodle/theme/cornflower/images/ sideblock.jpg [Sat Jan 21 21:03:31 2006] [error] [client 81.32.84.100] File does not exist: /extern/web/httpd/htdocs/moodle/theme/cornflower/ header_bg.jpg , referer: http://parles.upf.es/moodle/course/view.php?id=25 [Sun Jan 22 11:40:56 2006] [error] [client 62.15.248.130] File does not exist: /extern/web/httpd/htdocs/mellange/theme/greenshade15_mellange/ navbar.gif , referer: http://parles.upf.es/mellange/course/view.php?id=14 [Sun Jan 22 11:41:01 2006] [error] [client 62.15.248.130] File does not exist: /extern/web/httpd/htdocs/mellange/theme/greenshade15_mellange/ grey_shade_01.jpg , referer: http://parles.upf.es/mellange/course/view.php?id=14&edit=on The greenshade15_mellange theme is a slight modification of one of the wonderfull non-standard themes produced by Himmat Singh and his people and so the missing image files could be do to some mistake I made while fiddling around with the files (although I cannot these "missing" images in the folders I keep for the original theme). But I'm surprised that the problem also arises with the cornflower theme which is, AFAIK , one of the standard themes. I suppose all I have to do to solve the problem is to include images with these names in the relevant folders, the problem is I don't know where to find these images. Does anybody know about any workaround for this problem?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Missing images in some standard and non-standard themes
ResponsesInList.Text: I have found the same issue as Josep.  Many error log lines commenting upon the missing sideblock.jpg. Could someone please post this image? As a workaround, I have edited my \theme\cornflower\styles_layout. css and removed the non-existent link from the section: .sideblock .header { background-image:url(images/sideblock.jpg); text-align: left; padding:4px; } Thanks Scott

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Course featured image
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Mike, By saying "this Moodle" I presume you are referring to the Adaptable theme? The reason the renderer did not work in YOUR theme is  because you also need to add the renderers factory configuration code in your themes config.php file, as well as add CSS to style the output for this course listing In your themes stylesheet. Moodle theme design can have a steep learning curve that can break even the best of us some times. Anyway glad you got something to work...even if you did not like the theme.

ResponsesInList.Title: Aardvark drop down menus blocked
ResponsesInList.Text: Hello we are getting reports from some of our end users that the companies they work for have blocked the drop down menus produced by the Aardvark-svc theme. We have work based learners. It is difficult getting the full picture as we haven't experienced it ourselves but has anyone else had 'problems' with the menus not appearing but only for certain users? We are suspecting a possible IE security to tight, but at this point we are open to any ideas as we pretty much have no idea. Is it likely that business firewalls would block drop down menus? That is one of the suggestions. Thanks

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Aardvark drop down menus blocked
ResponsesInList.Text: a firewall can't block html/ java -script from loading in a browser, a firewall only allows certain ports to operate with certain programs (or at all) on a computer. My guess would be: 1) They're using Internet Explorer 6 2) They have javascript disabled (if you're using Aardvark 3, 4, or 5 release)

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Aardvark drop down menus blocked
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi I've been checking google analytics and it looks like we have got users on IE6. I've been running round trying to find an ie6 install but we all seem to have moved on. If you happen to have access to ie 6 if there is any chance you can test against this link http://moodle.westnotts.ac.uk and tell me if the drop downs work or not that would be fabulous. It sounds like that is more than likely my issue, but evidence would be good. Thanks.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Aardvark drop down menus blocked
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Heather, Seem to remember, but after a quick check couldn't find the actual discussion, that Shaun said he wouldn't be doing any more fixes for IE6 a while ago. IE6 seems to cause more and more problems especially as it doesn't seem compatible with any other IE or any decent browser and the yui menus just don't seem to work in IE6 on any of the themes that use them as far as I can find. I guess the problem you have is that if you are preparing courses etc. for people to use in other businesses, you have no control over the browser they use. - Advising them to update IE or better yet to switch to Firefox /Chrome may not be feasible. One solution might be to put some browser detection in place that stops the yui menus loading in IE6 and to provide a sideblock navigation as a sticky html block that appears on each page??? Richard

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Aardvark drop down menus blocked
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Thank you. I have now managed to get hold of IE 6 and yes that is the culprit. I think you are right we need to put something in place to detect it and direct or alternatively we will have to take the whole theme off and switch back to something more clunky for all our links which is a great shame. I will put up a statement saying best not viewed with IE 6 or words to that effect, but Business users often suffer from corporate melt down when updating is suggested! Thanks again.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Aardvark drop down menus blocked
ResponsesInList.Text: "Business users often suffer from corporate melt down when updating is suggested!" Corporate melt down? Corporate stupidity more like. Companies who run their businesses this way are not only putting their employees at risk but also their own company too as IE6 is a known security threat because of various security holes Microsoft have admitted they CANNOT FIX!

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Aardvark drop down menus blocked
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Heather, Was just replying to your message when I noticed Daniel's as well - basically I was repeating what Daniel suggested: Unlikely to be the firewall, more likely to be IE security settings blocking the javascript used by yui. I would hope that they're not still using IE6, but so many places still are that it's definitely another possibility. Richard

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Fordson v1.5.9 change column size Marketing Spot
ResponsesInList.Text: What version of Moodle please? Forum rules × Themes forum information Before starting a new discussion topic here, please check the Themes FAQ and or try a forum search for the answer that you are looking for. If you cannot find an answer then please read the following before you start to ask for help. When asking a question PLEASE: DO tell us which Moodle version you are currently using. To find the version, go to: Site administration -> Notifications. DO tell us the name and version of the theme you are using. To find the version, go to: Site administration -> Plugins -> Plugins overview, then click on 'Additional plugins'. DO post a screen shot if possible.  An image speaks a thousand words. DON'T expect an answer if you have not followed the above DOs. Last but not the least: Always follow the 'Site policy': https://moodle.org/mod/page/view.php?id=7080 Thank-you... Close

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Fordson v1.5.9 change column size Marketing Spot
ResponsesInList.Text: I'm Moodle 3.3+ (Build: 20170519)

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Fordson v1.5.9 change column size Marketing Spot
ResponsesInList.Text: With the way things are generated and with the mustache templates I do not see a way to make this happen. However, you could use the frontpage custom textbox to setup a grid and then put your content manually into the grid.  You'd essentially be hand coding your frontpage using standard html code and maybe putting custom CSS in the custom SCSS box on the colors page of Fordson if needed. By coding it yourself in the textbox you can make it look however you want.  Just copy the html code generated by the marketing tiles and then alter the grid and paste it in the custom textbox to suit your needs.  Then turn off the marketing tiles and use your custom code.

ResponsesInList.Title: Allow teachers to change theme logo
ResponsesInList.Text: I have had a number of teachers request the ability to change the logo in a given theme. This may also be similar to the request in discussion http://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=89892 We are currently trying to standardize on a theme for each school in our district. Within this theme, teachers would like to provide a different logo at the top. With this in mind I have created a header.html file that should allow teachers to do just such a thing. This may also solve the problem listed in the post mentioned above. If you use the attached header.html file any teacher should be able to create a "theme" folder in their files area and place a logo.gif or a logo.jpg file in this folder. The theme will check for the presence of the logo file in the current course files/theme folder and if it is found will replace the default logo for that theme. Additionally, I have set it up so the course title will appear as well along with the logo and the logo is only rendered if there is actually a path to an image somewhere on the server . This file is based on the Chameleon theme header.html and still includes the Chameleon include line. Please try this out and let me know if it works on your servers. It appears to work on my 1.8 development server so please give it a shot. Randy Orwin
